output.conclusion: By completing this course, students will gain a solid understanding of the principles and techniques behind privacy-preserving machine learning, enabling them to develop and deploy machine learning models that protect sensitive data.
output.introduction: This course provides an intermediate-level introduction to the field of privacy-preserving machine learning. We will explore various techniques that allow machine learning models to be trained and deployed without compromising the privacy of the underlying data. The course covers topics such as differential privacy, federated learning, homomorphic encryption, and secure multi-party computation.

chapters.chapterTitle: Introduction to Privacy and Machine Learning
chapters.description: Overview of privacy concerns in machine learning. Definitions of privacy, data sensitivity, and common privacy attacks. Introduction to the privacy-preserving machine learning landscape.
Discussion of various privacy risks associated with machine learning models, including membership inference attacks, attribute inference attacks, and model inversion attacks.
Formal definitions of privacy, such as k-anonymity, l-diversity, and t-closeness. Introduction to privacy metrics and their limitations.
Introduction to differential privacy (DP) as a rigorous framework for privacy protection. Definition of differential privacy and its parameters (epsilon and delta).
Exploration of different mechanisms for achieving differential privacy, including the Laplace mechanism, the Gaussian mechanism, and the exponential mechanism.
Understanding composition theorems in differential privacy, such as sequential composition and parallel composition, and their implications for privacy budgets.
Introduction to federated learning (FL) as a decentralized approach to machine learning. Overview of the federated learning framework and its advantages.
Detailed explanation of the federated averaging algorithm, a common technique used in federated learning for model training.
Discussion of privacy considerations in federated learning, including potential privacy attacks and mitigation strategies.
Introduction to homomorphic encryption (HE) as a cryptographic technique for performing computations on encrypted data. Overview of different types of homomorphic encryption schemes.
Explanation of different homomorphic encryption schemes, such as Paillier encryption, BGV encryption, and CKKS encryption.

chapters.chapterTitle: Applications of Homomorphic Encryption in Machine Learning
chapters.description: Exploration of applications of homomorphic encryption in machine learning, including secure model training and secure prediction.
Introduction to secure multi-party computation (SMPC) as a cryptographic protocol for enabling multiple parties to jointly compute a function without revealing their individual inputs.
Overview of different SMPC protocols, such as garbled circuits and secret sharing.
Discussion of how SMPC can be used for privacy-preserving machine learning tasks, such as secure model training and secure prediction.

chapters.chapterTitle: Advanced Topics in Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning
chapters.description: Exploration of advanced topics in privacy-preserving machine learning, such as privacy-preserving data synthesis and privacy-preserving model deployment.
Discussion of real-world case studies where privacy-preserving machine learning techniques have been applied.
Overview of future research directions in the field of privacy-preserving machine learning.
